intro: Serratula koreana, commonly known as Korean serrata, is a flowering plant native to Korea. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and has lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Serratula koreana is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
